ЁЯОи
Vichitrachitta (Curious Mind)

He was a person of versatile genius - a king, poet, musician, and architect. He wrote 'Mattavilasa Prahasana' (a Sanskrit satirical play).

ЁЯЫХ
Architecture (Rock-cut Temples)

He pioneered rock-cut temples in South India (Mandapa style). The Mandagapattu inscription proudly states that he built a temple without brick, wood, metal, or mortar.

тЪФя╕П
Pallava-Chalukya Conflict

Pulakeshin II (Chalukya) defeated him and captured the northern provinces of Kanchi, initiating a long rivalry.

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • Titles: Vichitrachitta, Mattavilas, Gunabhara, Chettakari (temple builder), Chitrakarapuli (tiger among painters).
  • Religion: First a Jain, later became a Shiva devotee under the influence of the Nayanar saint Appar.
  • Music: The Kudumiyamalai music inscription is believed to be from his time.
